title: Blues Pills - Devil Man EP (320CBR)
description:
Genres: Psychedelic Rock,Blues Rock,Soul.

Vocalist Elin Larsson, drummer Cory Berry, guitarist Dorian Sorriaux and bassist Zack Anderson aim to recreate the musical values of early Fleetwood Mac, 
Led Zeppelin,Black Sabbath,Cream and Jimi Hendrix.

Larsson says of Devil Man: Ã¢â‚¬Å“ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s one of the first songs we wrote, but itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s still one of our favourites to play. ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s just a simple riff with a good melody, 
played with lots of energy.
Fronted by Swedish soul-saviour, Elin Larsson, her voice is a powerful mix of Janis Joplin meets Aretha Franklin. Larsson isnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t coy to show off her 
compelling chords as the EP starts off with a 40 second vocal solo to introduce Ã¢â‚¬ËœDevil ManÃ¢â‚¬â„¢. 
LarssonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s got a hell of a backbone for a band behind her, the newest and youngest of which is guitarist Dorian Sorriaux whoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s playing is heavily 
70s-influenced. Drummer Cory Berry carefully masters the hard hitting edge of their rockier side but also has a feather touch dynamic during their softer 
songs like Ã¢â‚¬ËœDig InÃ¢â‚¬â„¢. The greatest part about this band is their ability to take the likes of Jimi Hendrix, Black Sabbath, Cream and Aretha Franklin and 
turn it into a sound that is groundbreaking and inventive and most importantly, one thatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s all of their own.  This is not just a fad band, Blues Pills has 
created timeless soul rock. Whichever genre you want to fall into, Devil Man has moments to both surprise and delight everyone. ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s edgy and riffy and 
tranquil and calm simultaneously. The perfect antidote to everyone searching for a sound that tells them how they should feel. In fact, maybe itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s just the 
perfect sound. This is a superb offering from such a youthful band. The only downside is that after 17 minutes and 4 songs it ends.

ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s impossible not to like this album. Every one of its four members has a special talent, which flourishes and speaks out in confidence. Go back to the 
past and be thrown into the forefront of rock simultaneously. This really is an out-of-body band. Learn, listen and love.
